newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: GMAC Australia debt issue priced 42 bp over.
newsitem.headline: GMAC Australia debt issue priced 42 bp over.

text.p: General Motors Acceptance Corporation Australia's debut A$100 million medium-term note (MTN) issue has been priced at 42 basis points over the November 2001 government bond, lead manager Westpac Banking Corporation said on Monday.
The notes, which were issued off GMAC's recently established MTN programme, mature Novemer 15, 2001 and carry a coupon of 6.25 percent.
The issue was priced to yield 6.275 percent, while the settlement date is August 21.
The issuer is 100 percent owned subsidiary of General Motors Acceptance Corporation.
The parent guarantees the notes issued under the programme and carry a long-term debt rating from Standard & Poor's of A minus, while Moody's Investors Service rated the programme A3.
Co-managers are ANZ Banking Group, Commonwealth Bank of Australia, Citisecurities Ltd, National Australia Bank and SBC Warburg Australia.
